page.title: 20Industry in Springfield
page.content: Near Springfield there is a{Porage {Oats factory.}The factory is one of the most up to date factories in Britain. It employs up to 80 people, 7 of them coming from Springfield. A.&.R. Scott have been producing porage, a breakfast food from oats for more than a 100 years. The oats are cleaned by passing through a separator which sorts the grain into 4 different types. Then the oats, intended for milling are passed down the kiln and then dried and partially toasted. Then only the best are made into oatmeal. The pinhead oatmeal is steamed and then passed through rollers to make oatflakes. These flakes are our porage oats. Animal feed is one of the main by products from the factory. People make a lot of other things with porage oats, for example, muesli, another popular breakfast food.
